contentrichtext.text: {{seealso|Wigwam (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox Nuclear weapons test |name = Operation Wigwam |picture = Wigwam.jpg |picture_description = |country = United States |test_site = 500 miles southwest of [[San Diego]] |date = {{date|1955-05-14}} |test_type = Underwater |device_type = Fission |yield ={{convert|30|ktonTNT|lk=in}} |previous_test = ''[[Operation Teapot]]'' |next_test = [[Project 56 (nuclear test)|Project 56]] }} [[File:Operation Wigwam test.ogg|thumb|250px|Video of the test]] '''Operation Wigwam''' involved a single test of the [[Mark 90 Betty nuclear bomb]]. It was conducted between [[Operation Teapot]] and [[Operation Redwing]] on May 14, 1955, about 500 miles southwest of [[San Diego]], [[California]]. 6,800 personnel aboard 30 ships were involved in ''Wigwam''. The purpose of ''Wigwam'' was to determine the vulnerability of submarines to deeply detonated nuclear weapons, and to evaluate the feasibility of using such weapons in a combat situation. The task force commander, Admiral [[John Sylvester]], was embarked on the task force [[flagship]] {{USS|Mount McKinley|AGC-7}}. The test device was suspended by a 2,000 foot (660 meters) cable under a barge. A six-mile tow line connected a fleet [[tug]], the [[USS Tawasa (AT-92)|USS ''Tawasa'']], and the shot [[barge]] itself. Suspended from the tow lines of other tugs were three miniature unmanned [[submarines]] named "Squaws", each packed with cameras and telemetry instruments. The time of detonation was 1300 hrs Pacific Time. The test was carried out without incident, and [[radiation]] effects were negligible. The device yielded 30 [[kiloton]]s. Only three personnel received doses of over 0.5 rems. The equipment intended for direct measurement of the [[underwater explosion|explosion-generated underwater bubble]] was not operational at the time of the shot, but based on other measurements, the bubble's maximum radius was calculated as 376 feet, and its pulsation period approximately 2.83 seconds. (See Scientific Director's Report)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dtic.mil/dtic/tr/fulltext/u2/a995030.pdf |title=Operation Wigwam Scientific Director's Report (Large PDF) |format=PDF |date= |accessdate=2012-03-24}}</ref> {| border="1" cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" style="margin:auto;" |+ '''Wigwam Test Blast''' |- ! style="background:#efefef;" | Test name ! style="background:#ffdead;" | Date ! style="background:#efefef;" | Location ! style="background:#ffdead;" | Yield ! style="background:#efefef;" | Note |- ! ''Wigwam'' | 14 May 1955 | 500 miles SW San Diego | 30 kilotons | deep underwater |} ==External links== *[http://www.dtra.mil/documents/ntpr/factsheets/Wigwam.pdf Operation Wigwam Test Report, DTRA (PDF)] * {{Internet Archive short film|id=gov.doe.0800018|name=Nuclear Test Film - Operation Wigwam (1955)}} == References == {{reflist}} {{coord|28|44|N|126|16|W|type:landmark_source:dewiki|display=title}} {{US Nuclear Tests}} [[Category:American nuclear explosive tests|Wigwam]]
